channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Paleontologists discover Colorado 'swamp dweller' that lived alongside dinosaurs
item.description: The new mammal lived in Colorado 70 to 75 million years ago -- a time when a vast inland sea covered large portions of the state, and animals like sha...

item.title: Dead coral skeletons left by bleaching events hinder reef recovery
item.description: Coral reefs are like underwater cities, with myriad species forming a thriving ocean metropolis. That complexity, however, can hinder a reef's surviva...

item.title: Pesticides affect the health of wild bees, important plant pollinators

item.title: Surfing atmospheric waves with tiny satellites
item.description: A U.S. National Science Foundation-supported team is designing and building three identical CubeSats, or shoebox-sized satellites, to study space weat...

item.title: What standing on one leg can tell you: Biological age
item.description: How long a person can stand -- on one leg -- is a more telltale measure of aging than changes in strength or gait, according to new research.

item.title: Saving the bats: Researchers find bacteria, fungi on bat wings that could help fight deadly white-nose syndrome
item.description: Bacteria and fungi from the wings of bats could play a significant role in saving them from white-nose syndrome (WNS), a fungal disease affecting the ...
